results.title: BRASH Syndrome: A Case Report
results.text_hl: A 76-year-old man with @DISEASE_Renal_Insufficiency_Chronic @DISEASE_MESH:D051436 @@@chronic kidney disease@@@ stage 3, essential @DISEASE_Hypertension @DISEASE_MESH:D006973 @@@hypertension@@@ and @DISEASE_Psoriasis @DISEASE_MESH:D011565 @@@psoriasis@@@, and receiving @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ presented to the Emergency Department with @<m>DISEASE_Lethargy</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D053609 @@@lethargy@@@ and @DISEASE_Muscle_Weakness @DISEASE_MESH:D018908 @@@weakness@@@ that started 3 days ago, with rapid deterioration into @DISEASE_Shock @DISEASE_MESH:D012769 @@@shock@@@.

citations.NLM: Bailuni Neto JJ, Siqueira BL, Machado FC, Boros GAB, Akamine MAV, Cordeiro de Paula LJ, Rodrigues de Assis AC, Soares PR, Scudeler TL. BRASH Syndrome: A Case Report Am J Case Rep. 2022 Jan 21;23():e934600. PMID: 35058422
citations.BibTeX: @article{35058422, title={BRASH Syndrome: A Case Report}, author={Bailuni Neto JJ and Siqueira BL and Machado FC and Boros GAB and Akamine MAV and Cordeiro de Paula LJ and Rodrigues de Assis AC and Soares PR and Scudeler TL}, journal={Am J Case Rep}, volume={23}, pages={e934600}}

results.title: Ventricular pre-excitation in cats: 17 cases.
results.text_hl: Clinical signs at presentation included @<m>DISEASE_Lethargy</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D053609 @@@lethargy@@@ (10/17 @SPECIES_9685 @@@cats@@@), @DISEASE_Tachypnea @DISEASE_MESH:D059246 @@@tachypnea@@@ (6/17 @SPECIES_9685 @@@cats@@@), and/or @DISEASE_Syncope @DISEASE_MESH:D013575 @@@syncope@@@ (3/17 @SPECIES_9685 @@@cats@@@).

citations.NLM: Sidler M, Santarelli G, Kovacevic A, Novo Matos J, Schreiber N, Baron Toaldo M. Ventricular pre-excitation in cats: 17 cases. J Vet Cardiol. 2023 Jun;47():70-82. PMID: 37267820
citations.BibTeX: @article{37267820, title={Ventricular pre-excitation in cats: 17 cases.}, author={Sidler M and Santarelli G and Kovacevic A and Novo Matos J and Schreiber N and Baron Toaldo M}, journal={J Vet Cardiol}, volume={47}, pages={70-82}}

results.title: Beta-adrenergic antagonist exposures in children.
results.text_hl: In the 1-center review, @CHEMICAL_Metoprolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008790 @@@metoprolol@@@ (28%) and @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ (27%) exposures were most common, but = 1 tablet of BA was involved in 83% of the exposures.

citations.NLM: Belson MG, Sullivan K, Geller RJ. Beta-adrenergic antagonist exposures in children. Vet Hum Toxicol. 2001 Dec;43(6):361-5. PMID: 11757997
citations.BibTeX: @article{11757997, title={Beta-adrenergic antagonist exposures in children.}, author={Belson MG and Sullivan K and Geller RJ}, journal={Vet Hum Toxicol}, volume={43}, number={6}, pages={361-5}}
